newsitem.title: USA: Moore County, N.C., mulls $38.4 mln GO referendum.
newsitem.headline: Moore County, N.C., mulls $38.4 mln GO referendum.

text.p: Two general obligation bond issues totalling $38.4 million could go before voters in North Carolain's Moore County in November, the Fayetteville Observer-Times said Tuesday.

The county school board voted 7-1 Monday night to ask county commissioners to put a $26.9 million bond issue before voters. The issue would finance construction of two new middle schools and renovations and expansions at existing schools.
The board of directors at Sandhills Community College are expected to approve a similar resolution next week seeking a referendum on $11.5 million of bonds for construction and renovation.
Dr. John Dempsey, chairman of the college board, said an opinion poll conducted for the college suggests the referendums would pass.
